page.title: 07Farm Housing and Woodland
page.content: {SOCIAL}- Mainly the farms are owned outright. However some acreage included is farmed on a tenant basis.In addition to the farming families there are an average 3.5 full time hands per farm or one person per 173 acres.Each farm has tied houses and/or cottages.The total of the four farms is: Houses 9 Cottages 16 Retired farm workers occupy 5 of the 25. {WOODLAND}- 53 acres of woodland were named which represents only 2% of the total acreage.A good variety of main species was noted,including: Oak,Ash,Apsen Willow,Chestnut,Silver Birch and Alder in the older woods. New plantings include Christmas trees (Norway Spruce) and mixed (Oak, Ash, Chestnut and Maple) also Birch ,Scots Pine and Poplar.
